meanings.definition: The student ranking second highest in a graduating class.
meanings.sent1: During graduation, the salutatorians gave a speech.
meanings.sent2: The salutatorians received recognition for their academic achievements.
meanings.sent3: The salutatorians joked about being the 'runner-up' in their class.
meanings.sent4: In the hierarchy of academic success, the salutatorians stand just below the valedictorian.
meanings.sent5: The salutatorians proudly represented their class on stage.

meanings.definition: The salutatorians delivered a speech at the commencement ceremony.
meanings.sent1: At the graduation event, the salutatorians spoke eloquently.
meanings.sent2: The audience applauded the salutatorians after their address.
meanings.sent3: The salutatorians added humor to their speech to lighten the mood.
meanings.sent4: The words of the salutatorians resonated with the graduating class.
meanings.sent5: The salutatorians' speech inspired their peers to aim high.
